node.name: get-config
node.description: Retrieve all or part of a specified configuration.None

node.name: source
node.description: Particular configuration to retrieve.None

node.name: config-source
node.description: The configuration to retrieve.None

node.name: candidate
node.description: The candidate configuration is the config source.None

node.name: running
node.description: The running configuration is the config source.None

node.name: startup
node.description: The startup configuration is the config source. This is optional-to-implement on the server because not all servers will support filtering for this datastore.None

node.name: filter
node.description: Subtree or XPath filter to use.None

node.name: ncwd:with-defaults
node.description: The explicit defaults processing mode requested.None

node.name: nct:scheduled-time
node.description: The time at which the RPC is scheduled to be performed.None

node.name: nct:get-time
node.description: Indicates that the rpc-reply should include the execution-time.None

node.name: data
node.description: Copy of the source datastore subset that matched the filter criteria (if any). An empty data container indicates that the request did not produce any results.None

node.name: nct:execution-time
node.description: The time at which the RPC was executed.None

node.name: edit-config
node.description: The &ltedit-config&gt operation loads all or part of a specified configuration to the specified target configuration.None

node.name: nct:execution-time
node.description: The time at which the RPC was executed.None

node.name: target
node.description: Particular configuration to edit.None

node.name: config-target
node.description: The configuration target.None

node.name: candidate
node.description: The candidate configuration is the config target.None

node.name: running
node.description: The running configuration is the config source.None

node.name: default-operation
node.description: The default operation to use.None

node.name: test-option
node.description: The test option to use.None

node.name: error-option
node.description: The error option to use.None

node.name: edit-content
node.description: The content for the edit operation.None

node.name: config
node.description: Inline Config content.None

node.name: url
node.description: URL-based config content.None

node.name: nct:scheduled-time
node.description: The time at which the RPC is scheduled to be performed.None

node.name: nct:get-time
node.description: Indicates that the rpc-reply should include the execution-time.None

node.name: copy-config
node.description: Create or replace an entire configuration datastore with the contents of another complete configuration datastore.None

node.name: nct:execution-time
node.description: The time at which the RPC was executed.None

node.name: target
node.description: Particular configuration to copy to.None

node.name: config-target
node.description: The configuration target of the copy operation.None

node.name: candidate
node.description: The candidate configuration is the config target.None

node.name: running
node.description: The running configuration is the config target. This is optional-to-implement on the server.None

node.name: startup
node.description: The startup configuration is the config target.None

node.name: url
node.description: The URL-based configuration is the config target.None

node.name: source
node.description: Particular configuration to copy from.None

node.name: config-source
node.description: The configuration source for the copy operation.None

node.name: candidate
node.description: The candidate configuration is the config source.None

node.name: running
node.description: The running configuration is the config source.None

node.name: startup
node.description: The startup configuration is the config source.None

node.name: url
node.description: The URL-based configuration is the config source.None

node.name: config
node.description: Inline Config content: &ltconfig&gt element. Represents an entire configuration datastore, not a subset of the running datastore.None

node.name: ncwd:with-defaults
node.description: The explicit defaults processing mode requested.None

node.name: nct:scheduled-time
node.description: The time at which the RPC is scheduled to be performed.None

node.name: nct:get-time
node.description: Indicates that the rpc-reply should include the execution-time.None

node.name: delete-config
node.description: Delete a configuration datastore.None

node.name: nct:execution-time
node.description: The time at which the RPC was executed.None

node.name: target
node.description: Particular configuration to delete.None

node.name: config-target
node.description: The configuration target to delete.None

node.name: startup
node.description: The startup configuration is the config target.None

node.name: url
node.description: The URL-based configuration is the config target.None

node.name: nct:scheduled-time
node.description: The time at which the RPC is scheduled to be performed.None

node.name: nct:get-time
node.description: Indicates that the rpc-reply should include the execution-time.None

node.name: lock
node.description: The lock operation allows the client to lock the configuration system of a device.None

node.name: nct:execution-time
node.description: The time at which the RPC was executed.None

node.name: target
node.description: Particular configuration to lock.None

node.name: config-target
node.description: The configuration target to lock.None

node.name: candidate
node.description: The candidate configuration is the config target.None

node.name: running
node.description: The running configuration is the config target.None

node.name: startup
node.description: The startup configuration is the config target.None

node.name: ncds:datastore
node.description:
Datastore to lock.
The &ltlock&gt operation is only supported on writable datastores.
If the &ltlock&gt operation is not supported by the server on the specified target datastore, then the server MUST return an &ltrpc-error&gt element with an &lterror-tag&gt value of 'invalid-value'.None

node.name: nct:scheduled-time
node.description: The time at which the RPC is scheduled to be performed.None

node.name: nct:get-time
node.description: Indicates that the rpc-reply should include the execution-time.None

node.name: unlock
node.description: The unlock operation is used to release a configuration lock, previously obtained with the 'lock' operation.None

node.name: nct:execution-time
node.description: The time at which the RPC was executed.None

node.name: target
node.description: Particular configuration to unlock.None

node.name: config-target
node.description: The configuration target to unlock.None

node.name: candidate
node.description: The candidate configuration is the config target.None

node.name: running
node.description: The running configuration is the config target.None

node.name: startup
node.description: The startup configuration is the config target.None

node.name: ncds:datastore
node.description:
Datastore to unlock.
The &ltunlock&gt operation is only supported on writable datastores.
If the &ltunlock&gt operation is not supported by the server on the specified target datastore, then the server MUST return an &ltrpc-error&gt element with an &lterror-tag&gt value of 'invalid-value'.None

node.name: nct:scheduled-time
node.description: The time at which the RPC is scheduled to be performed.None

node.name: nct:get-time
node.description: Indicates that the rpc-reply should include the execution-time.None

node.name: get
node.description: Retrieve running configuration and device state information.None

node.name: filter
node.description: This parameter specifies the portion of the system configuration and state data to retrieve.None

node.name: ncwd:with-defaults
node.description: The explicit defaults processing mode requested.None

node.name: nct:scheduled-time
node.description: The time at which the RPC is scheduled to be performed.None

node.name: nct:get-time
node.description: Indicates that the rpc-reply should include the execution-time.None

node.name: data
node.description: Copy of the running datastore subset and/or state data that matched the filter criteria (if any). An empty data container indicates that the request did not produce any results.None

node.name: nct:execution-time
node.description: The time at which the RPC was executed.None

node.name: close-session
node.description: Request graceful termination of a NETCONF session.None

node.name: kill-session
node.description: Force the termination of a NETCONF session.None

node.name: session-id
node.description: Particular session to kill.None

node.name: commit
node.description: Commit the candidate configuration as the device's new current configuration.None

node.name: nct:execution-time
node.description: The time at which the RPC was executed.None

node.name: confirmed
node.description: Requests a confirmed commit.None

node.name: confirm-timeout
node.description: The timeout interval for a confirmed commit.None

node.name: persist
node.description:
This parameter is used to make a confirmed commit persistent. A persistent confirmed commit is not aborted if the NETCONF session terminates. The only way to abort a persistent confirmed commit is to let the timer expire, or to use the &ltcancel-commit&gt operation.
The value of this parameter is a token that must be given in the 'persist-id' parameter of &ltcommit&gt or &ltcancel-commit&gt operations in order to confirm or cancel the persistent confirmed commit.
The token should be a random string.None

node.name: persist-id
node.description: This parameter is given in order to commit a persistent confirmed commit. The value must be equal to the value given in the 'persist' parameter to the &ltcommit&gt operation. If it does not match, the operation fails with an 'invalid-value' error.None

node.name: nct:scheduled-time
node.description: The time at which the RPC is scheduled to be performed.None

node.name: nct:get-time
node.description: Indicates that the rpc-reply should include the execution-time.None

node.name: discard-changes
node.description: Revert the candidate configuration to the current running configuration.None

node.name: cancel-commit
node.description: This operation is used to cancel an ongoing confirmed commit. If the confirmed commit is persistent, the parameter 'persist-id' must be given, and it must match the value of the 'persist' parameter.None

node.name: persist-id
node.description: This parameter is given in order to cancel a persistent confirmed commit. The value must be equal to the value given in the 'persist' parameter to the &ltcommit&gt operation. If it does not match, the operation fails with an 'invalid-value' error.None

node.name: validate
node.description: Validates the contents of the specified configuration.None

node.name: source
node.description: Particular configuration to validate.None

node.name: config-source
node.description: The configuration source to validate.None

node.name: candidate
node.description: The candidate configuration is the config source.None

node.name: running
node.description: The running configuration is the config source.None

node.name: startup
node.description: The startup configuration is the config source.None

node.name: url
node.description: The URL-based configuration is the config source.None

node.name: config
node.description: Inline Config content: &ltconfig&gt element. Represents an entire configuration datastore, not a subset of the running datastore.None

node.name: ncds:datastore
node.description:
Datastore to validate.
The &ltvalidate&gt operation is supported only on configuration datastores.
If the &ltvalidate&gt operation is not supported by the server on the specified target datastore, then the server MUST return an &ltrpc-error&gt element with an &lterror-tag&gt value of 'invalid-value'.None
